004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.MetersPerSecond;
008import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Volts;
009import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
010
011import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.HolonomicDriveController;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.ProfiledPIDController;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.SimpleMotorFeedforward;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.MecanumDriveKinematics;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.MecanumDriveMotorVoltages;
020import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds;
021import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
022import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.MutLinearVelocity;
023import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Supplier;
026
027/**
028 * A command that uses two PID controllers ({@link PIDController}) and a ProfiledPIDController
029 * ({@link ProfiledPIDController}) to follow a trajectory {@link Trajectory} with a mecanum drive.
030 *
031 * <p>The command handles trajectory-following, Velocity PID calculations, and feedforwards
032 * internally. This is intended to be a more-or-less "complete solution" that can be used by teams
033 * without a great deal of controls expertise.
034 *
035 * <p>Advanced teams seeking more flexibility (for example, those who wish to use the onboard PID
036 * functionality of a "smart" motor controller) may use the secondary constructor that omits the PID
037 * and feedforward functionality, returning only the raw wheel speeds from the PID controllers.
038 *
039 * <p>The robot angle controller does not follow the angle given by the trajectory but rather goes
040 * to the angle given in the final state of the trajectory.
041 *
042 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
043 */
044public class MecanumControllerCommand extends Command {
045  private final Timer m_timer = new Timer();
046  private final boolean m_usePID;
047  private final Trajectory m_trajectory;
048  private final Supplier<Pose2d> m_pose;
049  private final SimpleMotorFeedforward m_feedforward;
050  private final MecanumDriveKinematics m_kinematics;
051  private final HolonomicDriveController m_controller;
052  private final Supplier<Rotation2d> m_desiredRotation;
053  private final double m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond;
054  private final PIDController m_frontLeftController;
055  private final PIDController m_rearLeftController;
056  private final PIDController m_frontRightController;
057  private final PIDController m_rearRightController;
058  private final Supplier<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> m_currentWheelSpeeds;
059  private final Consumer<MecanumDriveMotorVoltages> m_outputDriveVoltages;
060  private final Consumer<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> m_outputWheelSpeeds;
061  private final MutLinearVelocity m_prevFrontLeftSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
062  private final MutLinearVelocity m_prevRearLeftSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
063  private final MutLinearVelocity m_prevFrontRightSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
064  private final MutLinearVelocity m_prevRearRightSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
065  private final MutLinearVelocity m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
066  private final MutLinearVelocity m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
067  private final MutLinearVelocity m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
068  private final MutLinearVelocity m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
069
070  /**
071   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
072   * trajectory. PID control and feedforward are handled internally. Outputs are scaled from -12 to
073   * 12 as a voltage output to the motor.
074   *
075   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path
076   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
077   *
078   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
079   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
080   *     provide this.
081   * @param feedforward The feedforward to use for the drivetrain.
082   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
083   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
084   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
085   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
086   * @param desiredRotation The angle that the robot should be facing. This is sampled at each time
087   *     step.
088   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
089   * @param frontLeftController The front left wheel velocity PID.
090   * @param rearLeftController The rear left wheel velocity PID.
091   * @param frontRightController The front right wheel velocity PID.
092   * @param rearRightController The rear right wheel velocity PID.
093   * @param currentWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the current wheel speeds.
094   * @param outputDriveVoltages A MecanumDriveMotorVoltages object containing the output motor
095   *     voltages.
096   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
097   */
098  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
099  public MecanumControllerCommand(
100      Trajectory trajectory,
101      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
102      SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward,
103      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
104      PIDController xController,
105      PIDController yController,
106      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
107      Supplier<Rotation2d> desiredRotation,
108      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
109      PIDController frontLeftController,
110      PIDController rearLeftController,
111      PIDController frontRightController,
112      PIDController rearRightController,
113      Supplier<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> currentWheelSpeeds,
114      Consumer<MecanumDriveMotorVoltages> outputDriveVoltages,
115      Subsystem... requirements) {
116    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "MecanumControllerCommand");
117    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "MecanumControllerCommand");
118    m_feedforward = requireNonNullParam(feedforward, "feedforward", "MecanumControllerCommand");
119    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "MecanumControllerCommand");
120
121    m_controller =
122        new HolonomicDriveController(
123            requireNonNullParam(xController, "xController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
124            requireNonNullParam(yController, "yController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
125            requireNonNullParam(thetaController, "thetaController", "MecanumControllerCommand"));
126
127    m_desiredRotation =
128        requireNonNullParam(desiredRotation, "desiredRotation", "MecanumControllerCommand");
129
130    m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond = maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond;
131
132    m_frontLeftController =
133        requireNonNullParam(frontLeftController, "frontLeftController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
134    m_rearLeftController =
135        requireNonNullParam(rearLeftController, "rearLeftController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
136    m_frontRightController =
137        requireNonNullParam(
138            frontRightController, "frontRightController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
139    m_rearRightController =
140        requireNonNullParam(rearRightController, "rearRightController", "MecanumControllerCommand");
141
142    m_currentWheelSpeeds =
143        requireNonNullParam(currentWheelSpeeds, "currentWheelSpeeds", "MecanumControllerCommand");
144
145    m_outputDriveVoltages =
146        requireNonNullParam(outputDriveVoltages, "outputDriveVoltages", "MecanumControllerCommand");
147
148    m_outputWheelSpeeds = null;
149
150    m_usePID = true;
151
152    addRequirements(requirements);
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
157   * trajectory. PID control and feedforward are handled internally. Outputs are scaled from -12 to
158   * 12 as a voltage output to the motor.
159   *
160   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path
161   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
162   *
163   * <p>Note 2: The final rotation of the robot will be set to the rotation of the final pose in the
164   * trajectory. The robot will not follow the rotations from the poses at each timestep. If
165   * alternate rotation behavior is desired, the other constructor with a supplier for rotation
166   * should be used.
167   *
168   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
169   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
170   *     provide this.
171   * @param feedforward The feedforward to use for the drivetrain.
172   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
173   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
174   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
175   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
176   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
177   * @param frontLeftController The front left wheel velocity PID.
178   * @param rearLeftController The rear left wheel velocity PID.
179   * @param frontRightController The front right wheel velocity PID.
180   * @param rearRightController The rear right wheel velocity PID.
181   * @param currentWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the current wheel speeds.
182   * @param outputDriveVoltages A MecanumDriveMotorVoltages object containing the output motor
183   *     voltages.
184   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
185   */
186  public MecanumControllerCommand(
187      Trajectory trajectory,
188      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
189      SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward,
190      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
191      PIDController xController,
192      PIDController yController,
193      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
194      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
195      PIDController frontLeftController,
196      PIDController rearLeftController,
197      PIDController frontRightController,
198      PIDController rearRightController,
199      Supplier<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> currentWheelSpeeds,
200      Consumer<MecanumDriveMotorVoltages> outputDriveVoltages,
201      Subsystem... requirements) {
202    this(
203        trajectory,
204        pose,
205        feedforward,
206        kinematics,
207        xController,
208        yController,
209        thetaController,
210        () ->
211            trajectory.getStates().get(trajectory.getStates().size() - 1).poseMeters.getRotation(),
212        maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
213        frontLeftController,
214        rearLeftController,
215        frontRightController,
216        rearRightController,
217        currentWheelSpeeds,
218        outputDriveVoltages,
219        requirements);
220  }
221
222  /**
223   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
224   * trajectory. The user should implement a velocity PID on the desired output wheel velocities.
225   *
226   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path -
227   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary end-states.
228   *
229   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
230   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
231   *     provide this.
232   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
233   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
234   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
235   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
236   * @param desiredRotation The angle that the robot should be facing. This is sampled at each time
237   *     step.
238   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
239   * @param outputWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the output wheel speeds.
240   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
241   */
242  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
243  public MecanumControllerCommand(
244      Trajectory trajectory,
245      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
246      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
247      PIDController xController,
248      PIDController yController,
249      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
250      Supplier<Rotation2d> desiredRotation,
251      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
252      Consumer<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> outputWheelSpeeds,
253      Subsystem... requirements) {
254    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "MecanumControllerCommand");
255    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "MecanumControllerCommand");
256    m_feedforward = new SimpleMotorFeedforward(0, 0, 0);
257    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "MecanumControllerCommand");
258
259    m_controller =
260        new HolonomicDriveController(
261            requireNonNullParam(xController, "xController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
262            requireNonNullParam(yController, "yController", "MecanumControllerCommand"),
263            requireNonNullParam(thetaController, "thetaController", "MecanumControllerCommand"));
264
265    m_desiredRotation =
266        requireNonNullParam(desiredRotation, "desiredRotation", "MecanumControllerCommand");
267
268    m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond = maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond;
269
270    m_frontLeftController = null;
271    m_rearLeftController = null;
272    m_frontRightController = null;
273    m_rearRightController = null;
274
275    m_currentWheelSpeeds = null;
276
277    m_outputWheelSpeeds =
278        requireNonNullParam(outputWheelSpeeds, "outputWheelSpeeds", "MecanumControllerCommand");
279
280    m_outputDriveVoltages = null;
281
282    m_usePID = false;
283
284    addRequirements(requirements);
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * Constructs a new MecanumControllerCommand that when executed will follow the provided
289   * trajectory. The user should implement a velocity PID on the desired output wheel velocities.
290   *
291   * <p>Note: The controllers will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path -
292   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary end-states.
293   *
294   * <p>Note 2: The final rotation of the robot will be set to the rotation of the final pose in the
295   * trajectory. The robot will not follow the rotations from the poses at each timestep. If
296   * alternate rotation behavior is desired, the other constructor with a supplier for rotation
297   * should be used.
298   *
299   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
300   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
301   *     provide this.
302   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
303   * @param xController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's x position.
304   * @param yController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for the robot's y position.
305   * @param thetaController The Trajectory Tracker PID controller for angle for the robot.
306   * @param maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond The maximum velocity of a drivetrain wheel.
307   * @param outputWheelSpeeds A MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds object containing the output wheel speeds.
308   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
309   */
310  public MecanumControllerCommand(
311      Trajectory trajectory,
312      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
313      MecanumDriveKinematics kinematics,
314      PIDController xController,
315      PIDController yController,
316      ProfiledPIDController thetaController,
317      double maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
318      Consumer<MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds> outputWheelSpeeds,
319      Subsystem... requirements) {
320    this(
321        trajectory,
322        pose,
323        kinematics,
324        xController,
325        yController,
326        thetaController,
327        () ->
328            trajectory.getStates().get(trajectory.getStates().size() - 1).poseMeters.getRotation(),
329        maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond,
330        outputWheelSpeeds,
331        requirements);
332  }
333
334  @Override
335  public void initialize() {
336    var initialState = m_trajectory.sample(0);
337
338    var initialXVelocity =
339        initialState.velocityMetersPerSecond * initialState.poseMeters.getRotation().getCos();
340    var initialYVelocity =
341        initialState.velocityMetersPerSecond * initialState.poseMeters.getRotation().getSin();
342
343    MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds prevSpeeds =
344        m_kinematics.toWheelSpeeds(new ChassisSpeeds(initialXVelocity, initialYVelocity, 0.0));
345
346    m_prevFrontLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.frontLeftMetersPerSecond);
347    m_prevRearLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.rearLeftMetersPerSecond);
348    m_prevFrontRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.frontRightMetersPerSecond);
349    m_prevRearRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(prevSpeeds.rearRightMetersPerSecond);
350
351    m_timer.restart();
352  }
353
354  @Override
355  public void execute() {
356    double curTime = m_timer.get();
357
358    var desiredState = m_trajectory.sample(curTime);
359
360    var targetChassisSpeeds =
361        m_controller.calculate(m_pose.get(), desiredState, m_desiredRotation.get());
362    var targetWheelSpeeds = m_kinematics.toWheelSpeeds(targetChassisSpeeds);
363
364    targetWheelSpeeds.desaturate(m_maxWheelVelocityMetersPerSecond);
365
366    m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.frontLeftMetersPerSecond);
367    m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.rearLeftMetersPerSecond);
368    m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.frontRightMetersPerSecond);
369    m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.rearRightMetersPerSecond);
370
371    double frontLeftOutput;
372    double rearLeftOutput;
373    double frontRightOutput;
374    double rearRightOutput;
375
376    if (m_usePID) {
377      final double frontLeftFeedforward =
378          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevFrontLeftSpeedSetpoint, m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
379
380      final double rearLeftFeedforward =
381          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevRearLeftSpeedSetpoint, m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
382
383      final double frontRightFeedforward =
384          m_feedforward
385              .calculate(m_prevFrontRightSpeedSetpoint, m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint)
386              .in(Volts);
387
388      final double rearRightFeedforward =
389          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevRearRightSpeedSetpoint, m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
390
391      frontLeftOutput =
392          frontLeftFeedforward
393              + m_frontLeftController.calculate(
394                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().frontLeftMetersPerSecond,
395                  m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
396
397      rearLeftOutput =
398          rearLeftFeedforward
399              + m_rearLeftController.calculate(
400                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().rearLeftMetersPerSecond,
401                  m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
402
403      frontRightOutput =
404          frontRightFeedforward
405              + m_frontRightController.calculate(
406                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().frontRightMetersPerSecond,
407                  m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
408
409      rearRightOutput =
410          rearRightFeedforward
411              + m_rearRightController.calculate(
412                  m_currentWheelSpeeds.get().rearRightMetersPerSecond,
413                  m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond));
414
415      m_outputDriveVoltages.accept(
416          new MecanumDriveMotorVoltages(
417              frontLeftOutput, frontRightOutput, rearLeftOutput, rearRightOutput));
418
419    } else {
420      m_outputWheelSpeeds.accept(
421          new MecanumDriveWheelSpeeds(
422              m_frontLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond),
423              m_frontRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond),
424              m_rearLeftSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond),
425              m_rearRightSpeedSetpoint.in(MetersPerSecond)));
426    }
427  }
428
429  @Override
430  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
431    m_timer.stop();
432  }
433
434  @Override
435  public boolean isFinished() {
436    return m_timer.hasElapsed(m_trajectory.getTotalTimeSeconds());
437  }
438}
